channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Four Michiganders Charged After Allegedly Voting Twice
item.description: Democrat Attorney General Dana Nessel announced Friday that her office filed felony charges against four Michigan residents who allegedly double-voted...

item.title: Kurdish official warns US: 'now is not the time' to pull forces out of Iraq'
item.description: As the U.S. mulls over a plan to withdraw troops from Iraq, its Kurdish allies have a message: Don’t forget us.

item.title: Are Dems Slow-Walking Hurricane Relief To Suppress An Election-Deciding Number Of GOP Voters?

item.title: Arizona Supreme Court Green-Lights Ranked-Choice Voting Ballot Initiative Riddled With Duplicate Signatures
item.description: 'What the AZ Supreme Court just affirmed is that as long as you can conceal your cheating long enough, you can fraud your way onto the ballot.'

item.title: AI assistants are ratting you out for badmouthing your coworkers
item.description: You shouldn’t give an AI assistant more power than a recent college graduate, C-suite exec suggests.

item.title: President Joe Biden Threatens 2024 Election Won’t Be ‘Peaceful’
item.description: Biden’s comments come roughly 24 hours before Trump returns to the site of his first failed assassination attempt in Butler, Pennsylvania.

item.description: Plan sponsors would be wise to focus on investment vehicle choice and fee structure. Share class choice impacts fees and investment performance.

item.title: Caffeine may be just the exercise booster you need—as long as you don’t over do it, say experts

item.title: Here's what two undecided Wisconsin voters are holding out for in the 2024 election
item.description: A small percentage of voters in battleground state Wisconsin are still undecided, but that sliver of voters could decide the election.
